Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: NaddyBrenny
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights. We were put in room one, and found it to be quite noisy due to the sound of other guests in the hotel. This is the only issue we had with an otherwise excellent hotel- good value for money, EXCELLENT location (quiet street, so close to everything), good breakfast (not large portion, already served, but absolutely enough for us), very clean. Front of hotel staff we neither super helpful nor neglectful- they answered any questions we had, which is better than the sales pitch we have received in some hotels, or the neglect of staff in others. Price was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and basic -- gets the job done”
Reviews.Author: socaltraveldreamer
Reviews.Content: I was really impressed with how clean this place was. For three nights, we stayed in the pension with a shared bathroom. I was nervous about what that might entail, but the bathrooms were immaculate. For the last two nights, we stayed in the hotel side and had a room facing the 7 Hills Hotel across the street. We had a balcony with a great view of the Hagia Sophia and an ok view of the Blue Mosque. The cleaning ladies are very friendly and sweet. Breakfast was simple but delicious. We spent time all over Istanbul, and I can honestly say that this place is located on of the quietest, but most centrally-located, tourist areas of Istanbul. I would stay here again and recommend it to my very picky friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value, lovely people”
Reviews.Author: bobagain
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in early April. The hotel's location is great; on a relatively quiet street, but in the heart of the tourist Sultanahmet quarter, within 1 block of major sights and tourist-y wants like travel agents, cash machines, food, etc. We booked the first night in a single for the first arrivee, but due to snafus at the airport, they upgraded her to the triple that we were to use for the rest of the stay for no extra charge. We added two nights to the original booking, no problem. They sent a shuttle to the airport in the middle of the night, no problem. Nb: the hotel charges in Euros, and requires cash. There's a cash machine 1 block away. Breakfast is minimal, but OK, a little monotonous. The deck view at breakfast is fabulous from outside, inside is a little stuffy. The room was functional, clean, and had some charming touches; double-glazed windows reduced any street noise (not eliminated - apparently reserving a room in the back helps). Be aware there's no elevator, so if you have a basement room and you're heading for breakfast, you've got four flights of stairs ahead of you. The staff are lovely, especially the maids. They insisted on carrying luggage, helped us getting settled in our rooms, going the extra mile with breakfast when we moved up to the top deck and smiling and being pleasant with every encounter. The owner was helpful and friendly, especially when we were introduced by a long-time patron of the hotel that we'd met at breakfast. Overall, we'd definitely return next time we're in Istanbul, should we have the fortune to return. Can't be beat for the price for a hotel in the most touristy section of the city.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Eyalm16
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Side Pension for 5 nights. The rooms were super clean and comfortable. The Location is prime- 2 minutes from Hagia Sophia, 5 mins to the Blue Mosque, 5 mins to the tram station. The staff were always friendly and helpful. to sum it up: for the price they offer, this is probably the best deal in town. lots of hotels in its vicinity charge much more. they might have bigger rooms or somthing like that- but what does it matter when in Istanbul? who wants to stay in the room anyway...? Highly reccomended!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap central and satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: melbournian1950s
Reviews.Content: Room was clean comfortable but with limited views - who really cares that much when the hotel was so close to the central attractions and the open air top of the building has such spectacular views and chairs to enjoy it from ! Breakfast cold plate was satisfactory. Staff were helpful. Overall, you can beat price and position.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot and will return”
Reviews.Author: BrissieDeb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this pension during the Istanbul Boat show and was very happy with it. Simple and spotless. Location was excellent, can see the Blue Mosque out the window and the Sopia Hagia off the terrace. Staff were very helpfull with arranging nice cheap airport transfers. I will be returning any time I come to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent pension”
Reviews.Author: Cosmicfriend
Reviews.Content: As most people already said, it it located in the old part of Istanbul, called the Sultanahmet. We Stayed for 4 days, in double rooms without bathroom in the Pansion(the cheapest category they have, 40â‚¬ for the room per day). The rooms are basic, meaning they have two beds, and a table. But as we were walking all day long we didn't need anything more than a bed. Beds are comfy, and it's very quiet, so they have great sleep quality. Everything is clean, you could says spotless, and the common bathrooms were cleaned a few times a day. Breakfest, as many others have pointed out is a weakness, but there are good restaurants near (Meat House, Ziya Baba, and one whose name I don't remember) There is lobby, where you can make instant tea (for free), or just sit around. The staff are helpful, they know English well enough to help you. The have free wifi, and 2 computers in the lobby, but you have to pays to use them. When you check out you can leave you bags in the luggage room until you have to depart which helped us, because we were leaving at 10 PM. All in all, a very pleasent experience, and if I visit Instanbul again, I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “2 Star with a View”
Reviews.Author: gfdenton
Reviews.Content: Traditional Turkish architecture is highlighted with gingerbread. This hotel is a class example. The price is low. It is clean, neat and the rooms are large. Location, location location, here you are in the very middle of Istanbul. And for breakfast, the roof terrace gives visual control of the Bospheros.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Merlin01
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel via the Internet very clean very cheap and the location of the hotel is fantastic. I would certainly return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small place in the heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Melikes
Reviews.Content: Side Pension - we have always chosen the pension side- is a cosy and comfortable place in the heart of Sultanahmed. It's just 2 minutes to the tram, which takes you to Eminonu, or Kabatas to go to Taksim, briefly: very central! The rooms are quite clean, and simply decorated; also comfortable. The only missing thing might be good shampoo, but this is just an exception. They serve a small, kinda basic Turkish breakfast on the terrace where you can see both Aya Sofya and Sultan Ahmed Mosque; and some view of the sea as well. Especially in summer, you'll be amazed by the view while having your breakfast with the company of good Turkish tea. The staff is generally friendly; you have wi-fi and free tea in the entrance of the hotel. I have stayed in Side Pension more than four times, and I'm quite sure I will have more visits to Istanbul and stay in Side Pension. If you are not used to hearing "azan" at 5:00 in the morning, do not get scared because Sultan Ahmed is very close and you hear the morning prayer as if the imam is calling it in your room!

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: extradry48
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Side Hotel for four nights in September 2011. Great location for all the tourist attractions in Sultanamet. Great value and very comfortable and good service. They arranged Airport transfer both ways as well. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Bijal_22
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for money. Centrally located in the Sultan Ahmet area. Good service. The breakfast was meager and monotonous as we got the same food every morning. The location was good as it is walking distance of 5 minutes to the Blue Mosque, The Hagia Sofia, The Topkapi Palace and the Underground water cisterns. The Grand Bazaar, the spice market and the Sirkechi train Station are all 15 minutes away. The Tram station is 5 minutes away. Very accessible to the whole city. Please note.... This hotel is in a zone where the roads are cobbled so you may have to carry some of your luggage if you take the Tram from the airport or the station.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a budget price”
Reviews.Author: polly_stone
Reviews.Content: Book the room on the top floor that has a small bacony that overlooked the Aiya Sofia and Blue Mosque. Wonderful at sunset.

Reviews.Title: “Small, cosy and very close to everything”
Reviews.Author: SeniorGlobetrotter
Reviews.Content: If you are in Istanbul to visit Sultanamet (i.e. the Bleu Mosque, Aya Sophia, Top Capi etc.) then this hotel is within a few hundred meters away from all of them! In addition they have affordable prices, good en-suite rooms and even more affordable pension rooms. Their continental breakfast on the top floor with roof balcony, gives you a very good view of it all! The staff speaks very good English, and are (most of the time) very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: John E
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in the heart of Sultanamet, right next to the Four Seasons, but pay only 60 Euros per night with breakfast, don't miss the Side Hotel. Not fancy, but friendly, clean, comfortable and with free-Wi-Fi. A 50-meter walk to the Old City Sultanamet, City Tour Bus, Blue Mosque, Palace of the Sultans, Archaeological Museum (an absolute must for B.C. artifacts including Sumerian Sanskrit tablets, Babylon's Ishtar Gate mosaics, Near East and Egyptian artifacts, sarcophagi, etc., etc.). NOTE: Your taxi driver will not be able to find the Side Hotel, UNTIL you tell him it is located next to the Four Seasons. FYI, 2 doors uphill is a small, affordable restaurant (with take away) where Mr. and Mrs. Jimmy Carter dined (avec photos). Breakfast is included but one must climb stairs to the rooftop scenic dining room. Atop that is a splendid scenic view of the Bosporus, Blue Mosque, etc..

Reviews.Title: “Basic accommodation in a priceless location”
Reviews.Author: mmbcross
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two periods, 30th. Sep. /1st. Oct. and 10th/11th. Oct. 2011. The location right next to the swanky Four Seasons and on a quiet street in the Sultanahmet would be difficult to beat at the price. There is a hotel and pension all in the same building. The hotel section has nicer furniture than the pension, but rooms are basically the same, using the same entry/foyer and rooftop terrace for breakfast. We were accommodated in a triple and a double in the pension. The room was spotlessly clean and the bed comfortable. We had one night table but no desk or chair and a very small closet, so suitcases had to be either on the bed or on the floor. Bathroom was large with plenty of hot water, but towels were measly and well used, probably second hand from the hotel section. Prior reviewers mention the free tea, free wifi, reasonable charge for computer and breathtaking location for breakfast on the rooftop terrace. Service at the front desk was spotty and the receptionist hardly fell over himself to help, but we did get the information we needed and there was plenty of literature, such as free maps. Be aware that itâ€™s a three storey building with no elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Great pension”
Reviews.Author: kimberlandia
Reviews.Content: I very much enjoyed my stay at the Side Pension. A co-worker had recommended it, and I'm glad she did. The room was large and colorful. The bathroom was clean. They had helpful information accessible (maps, ferry times), a book shelf for trade (leave a book, take a book), airport shuttle service, and a computer for internet very cheaply accessible. The location was great. And best of all was the terrace for breakfast. It had an absolutely amazing view of the Blue Mosque on one side and the sea on the other. Overall, we had a great experience at the Side Pension.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, clean, great price-have gone back”
Reviews.Author: saranger
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in the Pension twice Sept. 2-5 and again Sept. 17-20. Enjoyed our stays very much. Check in was quick and easy. Free hot tea 24/7 is a nice touch. No TV or phones in the Pension (where we stayed) which was nice. Free wifi throughout property. Quiet street just a block away from Four Seasons. Easy access from Metro, close to Aya Sofya and Blue Mosque. Rooms adequately provisioned. No wash cloths in rooms, so bring your own. Breakfast on rooftop terrace was plenty: bread, cheese, a hard boiled egg, cucumber, olives, and tomatoes with tea or coffee. It's a typical Turkish breakfast. You can order an omelet or Turkish coffee for an additional charge if you desire. Only addition I'd make to breakfast is to have orange juice. If you want a simple, clean and comfortable place to stay on a quiet street close to everything, you can't go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Good value pension”
Reviews.Author: MillOaks
Reviews.Content: The Side (that's pronounced sea-day) pension is located in a hotel and restaurant district, very close to the Blue Mosque and Aya Sophia. The rooms in the pension vary a lot - some really nice, some internal with no external windows. We were offered one of the less good rooms, said no and were upgraded to the hotel. The room here was pretty much the same as the good room our friends had in the pension - not sure why you would pay Â£20 a night more for it. The staff vary too - some very helpful, some dour and grumpy. Free tea and coffee in the lobby all the time. Reasonable breakfast on the terrace - boiled egg, cheese, bread, jam. Great views from the breakfast terrace and the top terrace. Good value, pretty quiet, recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed in the basement but liked it!”
Reviews.Author: Frizzettes
Reviews.Content: When booking our 3 last nights in Istanbul, I was told that there was only one room left. I booked it and only then was told the room was located in the basement. Wasn't too sure about this but we ended up liking the room as it was clean, newly built (renovated?). Comfortable bed, good breakfast on the terrace, close to the main attractions, quiet street. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view”
Reviews.Author: Chaipilates
Reviews.Content: I traveled solo to Istanbul and a friend of mine who was teaching in Ankara recommended this place. It was perfect for me! I had arranged for the hotel to pick me up from the airport and someone was there as soon as I landed. The pension is located in the heart of Sultanhamet with rooftop views of the Bosphorous straight, the Aya Sofia & the Blue Mosque. Needless to say it is very walkable -- great little neighborhood with lots of cafes and shops. I had a second floor, corner room on the street side of the hotel which was light filled with a great view and a great cross breeze. There are lockers on the first floor for valuables and a storage space for luggage if you need to check out earlier than your planned departure time. Breakfast is also included which is always nice and simply sitting on the rooftop terrace eating breakfast in Istanbul is a wonderful experience in and of itself. Oh, and as a solo female traveler, I felt very safe here. I would absolutely stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “A good, honest pension in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: zandsaway
Reviews.Content: Have you noticed that Tripadvisor doesn't really work in Istanbul? With so many reviewers who only give one review and, in broken English, would love to wax lyrical about the many qualities of each hotel, I thought it might be time to provide some real information. I stay here most of the time when I return to Istanbul, not because its romantic or luxurious, but because its safe, friendly, in a brilliant location and its (relatively) reliable. There is a charm to this building, and its both been pleasantly refurbished, as well as spotlessly kept. There are a range of rooms available, from the hotel rooms, which have their own bathrooms, to the pension where you can share for a cheaper price. For what you get, the prices are very good. For the location, it can't be beaten. Save your money for your adventures, and stay here!

Reviews.Title: “very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: teresa071
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this pension for a week and we recommended to everyone who wants to explore Istanbul. It is in a perfect location near everything, walking distance to the most historical places. Basic, very clean and very quiet. Nothing to complain. We recommended this place to everyone. it is a ***** five star basic pension. ;)

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable and best location in Sultanahmet, Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: dkanzler
Reviews.Content: Have a Turkish breakfast gazing at Hagia Sophia on one side and the Blue Mosque on the other. Location? Amazing...and across the street from the Four Seasons Hotel. An easy walk to the best sites in Sultanahmet and transportation to ferries and delights of the city. Clean and friendly. Bathrooms are basic...but clean. Pension rooms are very reasonable, but, if you are a light sleeper, choose a room away from the side street. It didn't bother me one bit, but more delicate sleepers were troubled.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: snowbird014
Reviews.Content: OUr flight arrived into Istanbul late at night so we were glad for the pick-up servce offered by the hotel. The driver was pleasant, although drove like a freakin' MANIAC!! Aside from that, we really enjoyed our stay here. Having originally booked the pension, we were upgraded to the hotel which was a bonus. The room was spacious and clean, and the shower was fantastic. The location is brilliant, with partial views of both the Ayia Sofia and the blue mosque from the roof. Breakfast was adequate, although the cucumber and tomato is obviously prepared the night before, so they're a little dry around the edges which might bother some people. The roof terrace is open all the time so its a great place to relax and enjoy the views. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “an ok place to stay, but wish breakfast was better!”
Reviews.Author: GloJul
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights at the end of our stay in Turkey. We found this place when we first arrived in Turkey since we didn't have a booking for when we came back to Istanbul later on, so we got to peek at the rooms before we decided to book. We booked a pension room with shared bathroom. At that time, they looked clean and had enough space which was still the case when we came back. Although it's a shared bathroom, it was very clean (although they could have given some bath mats for after the showers since the floor got wet every time someone used it) and the room was clean as well. Nice rooftop terrace with good views. The room was a little on the hot side. It was ok for the time of year we went (late May-early June), but couldn't imagine staying there in the summer. Definitely pay the extra for a room with air con if that's the case! But the beds were comfy and had a comfortable sleep since the area isn't too noisy. The only thing that irked us was breakfast. Although fresh, it's pretty boring and basic, especially after the amazing breakfasts we've gotten everywhere else in Turkey. If you want to get fancy and eat an omelet, you have to pay an extra 5 liras for that! We actually arrived really early on our check in day since we came on the overnight bus from Goreme, but fortunately, they had a room that happen to be available at that hour. I asked if we could have breakfast since we were there and we would miss it on our last morning since we would have to leave for the airport before it was served on our last day. They actually said no, which I wasn't expecting and said that since we checked in early, they technically should charge us for coming early (?). I read in their rules on the door after that they only charge if you use the room before 6 AM, and we arrived around 7:30-8AM so not sure what they were talking about. After seeing the boring breakfast and how many plates they prepare of it, we couldn't believe they begrudged us a few slices of bread, tomatoes and cucumber, a boiled egg and 4 olives! But generally, the price is ok and it's a perfectly fine place to stay. Just not the best that we experienced in Turkey. As for breakfast, we prefer to go out to the street and buy some borek instead. Yum, yum!

Reviews.Title: “good location and service”
Reviews.Author: StChris
Reviews.Content: The location is great, very close to Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia on a small side street. Note they do not take credit cards. Typical Turkish breakfast on the top floor. Our room was simple, with balcony and air-con. In the lobby are 2 computers and bottled water for small fee, free tea. Most of the staff was helpful and friendly. If you don't need a lot of frills, this is a good place.

Reviews.Title: “4 Days Trip”
Reviews.Author: cupofgreentea
Reviews.Content: After 10 years when I came for the first time, the hotel is still nice and clean. Best part of it is the terrasse where you can enjoyed the breakfast with a great view. If everything was fine, just a small point about the quality of the breakfast ... no croissant, just simple white bread, but it is a detail.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute bargain”
Reviews.Author: russAustralia
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Pension. No telly in the room otherwise you wouldn't know it wasn't a hotel. Good bed, clean room, comfortable. Very attractive hotel inside and out. Staff friendly and a little bit helpful but don't go out of their way much. That said, the fellow there in the mornings gives the clearest best directions.. Breakfast starts too late is my only gripe. It is three floors up with no lift but a stunning view, unbeatable I would say, Blue Mosque in one direction, Aya Sofya in another, Sea of Marmara in the third and the Bosphorous in the 4th.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, spotlessy clean”
Reviews.Author: MadameFeef
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights towards the end of April the room was spotlessly clean and decorated to a very high standard a real credit to the place. The only down side was that the breakfast could have been a bit better for the price, it wouldn't have harmed by offering juice of some sort and proper coffee. It could have been improved on. Apart from that it was fine, the staff were more than helpful. Didn't sleep too well but that was really on account of the noise from the mosque and not the hotel's fault at all. Would have no qualms about recommending or indeed staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and spacious rooms, good value for Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: EvanUTVol
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights twice for a total of 6 nights and was very happy with it. We stayed in the pension double which was basic, but the rooms and bathrooms are very spacious and extremely clean. Showers are nice and have really hot water, bathrooms are very clean and modern.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value!”
Reviews.Author: bllars
Reviews.Content: This is a perfectly located hotel 100 feet from the Four Seasons Hotel near the Blue Mosque in the heart of old town. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The breakfast is good and served in a sunny, cheerful room. Bulent Kipili, the hotel owner who is present every day, is just a delight ~~ generous with his friendliness and good spirit. We loved our stay here at this hotel and we recommend it highly. The rooms are reasonably priced with good value for the cost.

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for a clean hotel in a great location......”
Reviews.Author: travelmore4u
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Side Hotel for 4 nights. The rooms are basic but clean and spacious enough. The location of the hotel couldn't be better as it is walking distance to the Blue Mosque,Topkapi Palace,and the Grand Bazaar and Spice Market. The breakfast is the same each day: cucumbers,olives,bread,cheese,jelly/butter, and hard boiled eggs with your choice of beverage. The breakfast staff was very kind and helpful. The front desk on several occasions could have been more friendly and forthcoming with details. We felt like once we checked into the hotel they were done answering our questions. The hotel will arrange for a shuttle to and from the airport. There is one that is 30 euros (1 way) but there is also one that is 10 euros per person (1 way) that we didn't know about before we arrived. If you are looking for a clean place with a great location this is your hotel in Istanbul...if you need a very helpful front desk staff then you may want to keep searching.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: DanRandom
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the pension side for four nights (two stays) in April. The room (#28) was nice, relatively quiet, had a nice little sitting area, good sized bathroom (almost American hotel like in its size), no view to speak of, and was immaculately clean. No one cared as we came in and out at all hours, WiFi was free and strong, free breakfast was decent, you could make tea in the lobby at all hours. I felt like we got a good value for the money and I cannot think of a single bad thing to say. The location is PERFECT for exploring the tourist sites of Istanbul. You are a 5-10 minute walk to the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Topkapi Palace, Basillica Cistern, and Istanbul Archeology Museum. It's another 5 minutes to the Grand Bazaar, and an easy walk to the tram to take you to Taksim or other parts of town. As one writer says below, this is not the "real" Istanbul - it's a tourist center. But it is perfect for exploring the city as a tourist. We were charged 40 Euro for a pickup of four people at Ataturk Airport (we knew the amount in advance), and they were flexible as our flight plans changed last minute. However, the shuttle bus back to Ataturk, while not your own private vehicle, was 10 Lira/4.5 Euro per person. I'd advise that on the way back. I did not think the Istanbul Metro/transit system was a viable option.

Reviews.Title: “6th visit- still fine”
Reviews.Author: MTL1969
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 5 over a number of visits between 10 and 6 years ago and just went back for one night. Paid 40 EUR for a single room in the hotel. The rooms on the top floors were being painted so i stayed on the ground floor- not much of a view. I know that some of the 3rd floor rooms have tiny balconies so ask for those if you can. It's hard to fault this hotel though- i think the price is good, even if you can find cheaper places, the Side is clean, the bathroom is fine, and the rooftop is nice. Yes, the Seven Hills across the street has a better rooftop but rooms are triple the price. The location is perfect for sightseeing- albeit very touristy so it might be a good idea to spend only 2 or 3 nights here and also stay somewhere else in the city. The wifi was free and worked great.

Reviews.Title: “clean and simple, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: angibbons
Reviews.Content: If you stay in Istanbul, stay in Sultanahmed. The hotel is just a few hundred meters from the blue dome and aya sofiya. Free breakfast & internet and nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Peej
Reviews.Content: I'd recommend this place - it was a nice pension with a great rooftop deck for breakfast. We stayed here for a few nights in November. Wonderful location, right in the heart of Sultanhamet, which is where you'll spend most of your time in Istanbul anyway. Of course, if you're looking for a place that is more local and native in character, this is not the neighborhood to stay in.... its virtually all tourists here. The restaurant across the street has a rooftop deck that has outrageous views of the city - really spectacular, with equally outrageous prices. But having a drink on the rooftop deck is not too expensive and is fantastic at sunset.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great - for two days - then you realize that real Istanbul citizens don't come close to Sultanhamet”
Reviews.Author: Scottye133
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the Istanbul Marathon. It came highly recommended and mostly lived up to the hype. It is in the old town which houses the backpacker hostels and uber-touristy carpet stores. Everyone speaks English, but too well. Cab ride to Taksim Square where the real Istanbul is 15TL and a tram ride is cheaper. The hotel was clean and the staff were mostly helpful, though one desk attendant couldnt recommend a restaurant in the area most likely because he knows they are all overpriced and inauthentic. The views from the terrace made the 50 euro price almost worth it though the seven hills hotel across the street has one more level and seemingly offers better vistas. I recommend this place, but only for two nights. Do the tourist stuff in Sultanhamet and then grab another hotel in Taksim or Kadikoy in Asia.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed.... the perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: zrooster99
Reviews.Content: I cannot imagine a better location for an Istanbul hotel... everything is within walking distance, even the Spice Bazaar! Contantine's Column, New Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, the Cistern, Grand Bazaar, Spice Bazaar, etc etc etc. Service was excellent, breakfast was sufficient, price was amazing, room was very clean, staff was very friendly and helpful, and the location is perfect! Only cons... our room was hot (in October)... and the tile hallways and stairs made things louder than we'd like.

Reviews.Title: “I stayed in the pension portion of the...”
Reviews.Author: AllSignsPointNorth
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the pension portion of the establishment, which is less expensive than rooms in the hotel, so I was expecting a fairly bare bones room. I was amazed when I walked in and found it not only to be a substantial size but also quite tastefully decorated and absolutely IMMACULATE. The room (including the bathroom) were pristine and so comfortable. As with most hotels in the area, the room rate also included Turkish breakfast. Although the items were fairly standard, it was clearly prepared with great care and the gentleman working in the dining room was always cheery and welcoming when guests arrived for breakfast. The terrace is also absolutely stunning and offered 360 degree views of the city. The only (very minor) downside was that the staff at the front desk weren't terribly friendly. While they met requests and handled check-in and check-out efficiently, I didn't see so much as a smile in the two days I was there. Not a big deal, but just not the same level of customer service I had grown accustomed to in Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service!!!”
Reviews.Author: bangkokcritter
Reviews.Content: This used to be a great place, but now they don't seem to care about their guests - even those who had stayed there many times years ago. My husband and I arrived late at night and were handed the key and told to carry our own luggage up two flights of stairs. The young man at the desk told us he couldn't help us because he had a bad back. The rooms were drab albeit it clean. We ended up checking out the next day. For a few dollars more, I recommend the Sari Konak Hotel - a beautiful boutique hotel close to the Side. The Side is very pricey for what you get, namely very rude staff, drab rooms, and a very mediocre breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Outrages!”
Reviews.Author: GleeKid
Reviews.Content: My turkish friend had a guest from Prague last week and they made reservation for two.But the front desk didn't let my turkish friend in when they show up! Because they were not married! Not finished yet...What is more,They might have let her in but they didn't BECAUSE she is turkish! And he is not! I'm sorry,how embarrasing this is? So you are assuming everyone without a ring a hore? If you have that kind of a policy you should mention it on your website!!!! Beside,you can't have this kind of a policy, first of all it's not legal and it's offensive AND it's unprofessional if you have any concern about this! Is this supposed to be a turistic hotel? How? With this kind of perception?No way. I worked in a hotel as guest relation manager and i'd understand if they were just being cautios and suspicious.It's okay.But the way things were just rude.It's not a Walk-in,it's a reservation,you can not turn people down and send ONE away like that.The gendre or the ethnicity doesn't matter. In this case,they should at least return the money back.But even if they were asked they refused it.Is this how you represent the turkish style wellcome?I don't think so. This kind of places should be out of this job.Or at least the poeple who are responsible for this attitude.

Reviews.Title: “great location, views and value for money”
Reviews.Author: CanuckinBlighty
Reviews.Content: We stayed at a couple places in Istanbul and this Pension was the best place by far for location, views (Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia) and value for money. The breakfast on the terrace is very nice & filling (Turkish style) and the views are great in the evening as well, free tea/luggage storage, clean rooms with towels and bedding seen to every day and a fan in each room b/c it does get hot. They offer free wifi if you can use it but also have a couple computers that can be rented out too - not needed for our trip but one of those 'nice to haves'. What i loved best was that we were only a few streets off the main bit on both sides but it was quiet so you could get a good nights sleep but not have to trek far to see the main sites of Istanbul. I have seen some of the reviews haven't had good front desk experience and i can see how that would happen but the staff were good when we were there so i guess we were lucky, could be just a few individuals...

Reviews.Title: “one of best hotels anywhere”
Reviews.Author: rodthesod
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Side five times over the past ten years & have, obviously, always found it to be a most pleasant place to stay. Not expensive considering it's right in the centre of the Sultanahmet & so close to all the main attractions. The staff have always been most friendly &, with one exception, helpful - in particular, I always look out for one rather special breakfast waiter whose very quiet & unobtrusive, very courteous & really attentive to guests needs. He's always worthy of a generous tip on your last breakfast. It's a modest but very comfortable place &, although the views from the terrace are slowly becomming bocked out over the years, you can still get a view over the Bosphorus - paticularly if you go right up to the very top platform. You can also take your drinks up to the breakfast terrace in the evening & enjoy the view with friends & chat with other guests. Unfortunately, it has no lift - which wouldn't quite "fit" the place anyway, & is only a minor issue given all the overall plusses. Despite popular misconceptions the Sultanahmet is definitely the best precinct to stay in Istanbul - it's relatively peaceful during the day & packed with life at night, full of good small-ish local cuisine restuarants - many with roof-top views over the City/Bosphorus. Forget Taxim - it's overpriced & just doesn't have the " Olde Worlde" character of the Sultanahmet.! However, having said that, the most spectacular, if not the best food, place to dine is up the top of the Galata Tower - it's something every visitor to Istanbul needs to do, at least ,once! Enjoy your stay at Side!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: larryjhs
Reviews.Content: I stayed there over 10 years ago & it was basic but good. Now, it is SPOTLESS and tastefully decorated a la Turque. I stayed in the basement without a/c and a fan (but my own bathroom), and it was reasonable at night (and it was hot outside) . There was very little street noise. At 30euros a night you can't complain, though the wireless is better near the door (well, it is the basement). The terrace breakfast is excellent, though I wish there was yoghurt. Staff are friendlyish, but could try a bit more--it could be the summer, and seeing how some customers treat them, I don't blame them for being off hand and seen it all at times and same family has run the place for years and might need a holiday themselves. But I even helped them type up a notice (English grammar). The shutttle to the airport is only 10TL by the way There is no lift/elevator. I much prefer this place to an expensive but nameless hotel I had been at on the same trip for a business conference. It is local, and well-located, and cheap laundries are nearby and if you move out of the shopping and market area of Sultanahmet, dining out is very cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; quite basic; one very rude member of staff”
Reviews.Author: number51
Reviews.Content: Having never been to Istanbul before, I have nothing to compare the Side Hotel against in terms of value for money (we paid about Â£61 per night in June 2010 for room 19). The hotel is quite basic, but perfectly clean and functional, although the colour scheme and lighting donâ€™t provide much in the way of atmosphere. The rooftop terrace was a pleasant enough place to eat breakfast with views over the intervening streets to the Bosphorus; breakfast was basic with all the ingredients already laid out per plate, a practice aimed to discourage going back for a bit more bread or cheese. The best thing about the Side is the great location in the heart of Sultanahment, literally just a few minutes from Haghia Sophia, Blue Mosque, etc. The worst thing about the hotel was one of the desk staff (I think the one that the previous reviewer referred to); at best he was coolly indifferent, at worst positively rude and unhelpful: when I went down to ask if her could book a taxi, he tersely stated â€˜we donâ€™t do thatâ€™. When he wasnâ€™t on duty, however, the other desk staff were fine. Despite these gripes, would recommend the Side for the location alone.

Reviews.Title: “an incredibly rude receptionist”
Reviews.Author: nomadita
Reviews.Content: the good news: room number 9 in the pension was quite bright and cheerful. I was happy to be there. all of the people I met behind the reception desk were very nice... the bad news: ...except one, the cross-eyed, middle-aged man... I planned to settle my bill the night before an extremely early flight. He asked me to just do it the next morning. I was taken aback, and I explained that I had an early flight. he said, "well hurry up, I am eating my dinner over there." I could not believe my ears. it is too bad for the hotel that one rude receptionist spoils the hotel, but I cannot recommend that anyone stay here for the poor service, and I'll be sure to alert my guidebook's staff as well. less of a big deal but still duly noted: the sign in the lobby says they charge 25 euro for the shuttle to the airport, whereas you can book the shuttle at many other agencies for 5 euro (ex: the guy with the kiosk right outside aya sofya). I am left to wonder, after seeing all the travel guide reviews of the hotel plastered in their lobby, that their prior praise has gone to their heads. when I went back to Istanbul the next week I had a very amenable, lovely stay at the Hanedan Hotel. it was the same price for a better, larger room, helpful staff, way better breakfast on the roof with a glorious view of the aya sofia as well as the sea. go stay there!

Reviews.Title: “charming pension in the heart of sultanahmet...”
Reviews.Author: denaliboy
Reviews.Content: stayed two nights in the side hotel and pension (we stayed in the pension side). it was a lovely pension with a room. i loved the colorful blue walls, the iron-framed bed, and an excellent bathroom/shower which rivals that of my home. the location is great (minutes from the big three must see's: blue mosque, hagia sophia, and the topkapi palace). i believe the pension side lacks AC; the fan was adequate in mid-june. breakfast was above average with the usual turkish fare: cucumbers, tomatoes, olives, a boiled egg, and bread. however, the view from the rooftop terrace was stunning (one can see the blue mosque, hagia sophia, and the bosphorus). when we return to istanbul, we will definitely stay here again! it's a gem for 50 euro/night.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms - rude front desk”
Reviews.Author: FlowerOxford
Reviews.Content: This pension cannot be faulted on the cleanliness of the rooms, the daily cleaning OR the location. It is hard to find anything positive to say about the arrogant/dismissive/unhelpful people at the front desk. Luckily I have been to Istanbul before and needed no information, but for the luckless inidviduals on their first trip, they were faced with the surly 'Oh no not another b----y question' attitude. They did stop short of saying 'Look here, you are a TOURIST, do not expect me to be NICE, I just want your money'. Cos that was how it felt. If you like hard boiled eggs, processed cheese triangles, jam in plastic pots - you will like breakfast. (I have lived in the middle East and egg and cheese is common in hotels at breakfast, but its often haloumi with fresh olives).

Reviews.Title: “A perfect little hotel and hideaway!”
Reviews.Author: GaryNDIana
Reviews.Content: Our little group of educators recently spent 10 days and nights at the Side (See-Day) hotel. One of our travelmates has been coming here for many years and we see why. The rooms were nice, the staff was kind and caring, and the owner's older brother made breakfast for all guests every morning. A positive experience to be sure. We were very close to 3 of the great sights and some of the ofther sights were just a 10 minute walk away. The main street (street car connection) was also very close and we discovered "Cigdam", a local sweet shop and bakery Just up the street from the trolley stop. Everything we ate there was fresh. Try the chocolate collar filled with layers of geniose, cream parisian, and topped with fresh raspberries. A wonderful city to be sure!

Reviews.Title: “Side Hotel and Pension: Jekyll and Hyde”
Reviews.Author: efsch
Reviews.Content: Hotel-Pension Side has it admirers and detractors. I am a bit of both. The location is ideal, just a short walk from Istanbulâ€™s big three tourist attractions (Blue Mosque, Hagia Sopia, Topkapi Palace) and from the Sultanahmet tram stop (just 2USD=3TL=1.5EU from the airport by metro and tram). I booked a single room without bath, the only room category available in late March for my mid-April stay. Although there are reports of rooms without external windows and back rooms facing air conditioners, I was given a very nice front room with large windows and twin beds. The room was pie-shaped, and about 120 sq.ft. = 11 sq.m. in size. The bathroom was across the hall and was clean and almost always available. My room started out very clean, but remained ostensibly untouched during the first four days of my stay (I left early and forfeited the last two days of a six day pre-paid reservation for reasons discussed below). I did obtain a fresh dry towel from the front desk after the third day. The hotel web site has good information about the hotel, including photos. They make it clear that they hold an internet reservation with oneâ€™s credit card number, but payment is in cash, due on arrival. The front desk is flexible about currencies (TL, USD, and EU are all acceptable; currency conversion rates are based on internet quotes at the time of payment). There is a three day cancellation notice, so I did not request a refund when I left two days earlier than planned. Recent reviews have almost uniformly complained about the front desk staff. I found them neither friendly nor unfriendly. They did not seem eager to please, but they did fulfill requests. Their attitude made no difference to me. As a rule of thumb, younger staff (such as the night staff) tended to be more accommodating than older staff. Recent reviews have also faulted the (included) breakfast. A noticeable effort has been made to improve this. The breakfast now includes an omelet. The breakfast staff is quite friendly, and the view from the breakfast room and the roof terrace is awesome. Two internet terminals are available near the front desk at a nominal charge (1 TL per 30 minutes). This was very useful for those guests who were trapped by the volcanic eruption and needed to re-book flights into northern Europe. Safe deposit boxes are available without charge, but be aware that the safe box master key is not monitored -- on request it is handed to each guest who then uses both keys to access his safe box, which is located down the hall from the front desk. The safe box key looks like a smaller version of the room key, and I handed in the wrong key once when departing. Luckily I returned minutes later and corrected my error before anyone accessed my safe box. I was less fortunate regarding room security. As I mentioned, no one ostensibly entered my room during my four day stay. The bed was untouched, the bath towel unchanged, and the room uncleaned. The daily tip that I always leave for housekeeping also remained untouched. I did not tip at the end of my stay. However, at some time during my stay someone entered my (always locked, even when I went to the bathroom) room and picked apart the zipper on my carry-on, which I also locked. Nothing was stolen, but my damaged carry-on, which now has a non-functional main zipper, cost more than my entire hotel stay. This attempted theft, coupled with disruption of air travel due to the volcanic eruption, led to my early departure. At the last minute I was able to fly stand-by, and arrived home from the Hotel-Pension Side safe but disillusioned.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good size room, friendly family run hotel.”
Reviews.Author: eyam
Reviews.Content: Stayed in pension side for 4 nights, great place clean and space good in room. Had room at front of pension and not noisy at night. Breakfast nice and staff very helpful. would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: storm78900
Reviews.Content: When I was initially looking for hotels for my trip to Turkey, I noticed that the few negative reviews of Side mostly talked about the unfriendliness of the night staffers. I just wanted to come on and say that this was not my experience at all, and I thought the night staff were really helpful and kind. I stayed at Side for four days, and then stored my luggage there while I was in Bursa for the weekend. I came back from Bursa at around 11:30 on Sunday night, and had a flight leaving at 7:00 the next morning. I didn't want to pay for a hotel room since I was leaving so early, and figure I would sit in the Side lobby until they kicked me out, and then maybe go and sleep at the airport from there. I assumed, especially after the reviews on here, that the man at the desk would be annoyed by my presence, and I'd have at best an hour before he either asked me to pay for a room or kicked me out. Quite the contrary. Not only did he let me use the internet and drink tea free of charge as if I were still a guest, I also was able to curl up on the couch and sleep for a while. I curled up on the smaller couch that was farther away and less noticeable so I wouldn't be a bother, but he actually approached me and suggested that I sleep on the larger couch near the front, so I could spread my legs out and be more comfortable. He woke me up at 4:15 and called a cab for me to get to the airport. This was very nice of him to do, as I had already checked out and paid my bill three days prior, and he could have easily and justifiably asked me to leave that evening at no consequence to him. I am really grateful for this, and had a much more comfortable rest than I would have at the airport. He was very pleasant and nice, not rude in any way. To sum up, please don't avoid this hotel because you may think the night staff is unfriendly, I really had a great experience with them. In general, the hotel was very clean, in a fantastic location, and a great price. This is the cheapest place I could find in the Sultanahmet area, next to Eurasia hostel, which isn't nearly as nice on the inside (I had a friend staying in there and was able to see the inside). I will definitely book at Side again if I come back to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and clean room makes up for "so-so" staff”
Reviews.Author: kiska05
Reviews.Content: As most reviews say, this locations is superb. It's maybe a 6 minute walk from the Sultanahmet tram stop and 5 minutes to the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia. Our room in the pension had a very clean and nice private bathroom, and the room was decent (and clean!). I wouldn't recommend the pension for people who want to spend long afternoons in their room lounging as there was nothing but beds and a small night stand and mini wardrobe in ours. However, if you are in Istanbul and want a fantastic location, THIS IS IT! We walked everywhere, the spice market, grand bazaar, cisterns, main ferry dock, summer palace, etc. Reception service was so-so. I wouldn't complain about it, but no one was overly helpful there. The owner served us our breakfast several times, he was definitely friendly and responded to our small requests for extra jam, etc with smiles and a helpful attitude. If you are a semi-self sufficient traveler who doesn't need to have a concierge- type service, there are plenty of other travel-helpful stands/booths nearby. Overall, the location (for the price) is fantastic. I'd definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Used to be so good.”
Reviews.Author: julburs
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Side in 2005, and it was great. Stayed in the pension, which had basic rooms but was kept immaculate, with nice decor, decent beds and decent bathroom. The reception was great and very helpful, and you could often find the owner hanging around at breakfast, ready for a chat. When I got ill, the staff took care of me, as I was travelling on my own. It was wonderful. It was on the strength of my previous visit that I recommended it to friends and family in 2008. What an embarassment. Most checked out after only a night or two. The staff was exceptionally rude, and pretty much useless at anything. The breakfast had gone from basic but tasty Turkish, to stale bread, three olives, one slice tomato, and a triangle of processed cheese. You had to ask for jam. The rooms were still clean, but the it looked like no money had been re-invested since my last visit. The bed linens were starting to get threadbare, the pillows were like rocks, the towels had holes. I know this was the pension side, but those staying in the hotel fared the same. As far as I know, the only difference between the two is that the hotel rooms have A/C. Also, as others have mentioned, beware the credit card scam. They claim the machine to be broken when you check out, forcing you to pay cash. Yet, if for any reason you need to check out early, or break a reservation, they will quite happily charge your card. Overall, it's not the quality of the rooms or hotel that I'm basing my bad review on, but the poor staff. Thoroughly ruined what was supposed to be a wonderful family get together.

Reviews.Title: “If ever in Istanbul, will choose it again”
Reviews.Author: celmins
Reviews.Content: Spent 10 nights at the end of January 2010, had single room in Pension. Very satisfied choosing this place - location is perfect, free wifi in room, service very good. The Pension rooms don't have air condition, and no TV. Considering in was winter, AC was not essential, heating was so good, had to open window time after time to cool the room. Note, breakfast always the same, so in 10 days it became a bit boring, i mean, there is no selection table, u always get the same plate with 4 pieces of white bred, boiled egg, small packed cheese, jam and butter, few olives, few tomato and cucumber slices, thats all, and always the same. Though, coffee, tea, cacao for selection (not sure is it the same breakfast place for pension and hotel). One night had drunk noisy neighbor, returning late from a party, then could hear all strong sounds he did behind the wall, i mean, rooms are not very well isolated, but it must no be common to have such a neighbor, perhaps rare. All in all good place to stay, like it, and will choose it, if ever in Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service from the front desk”
Reviews.Author: Javawillie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Side Hotel for a week in January 2010. Though the hotel and location were fine, the front desk staff were neither helpful or friendly. When asked if they could recommend a nearby restaruant, they said "just walk around outside...you'll find something". All of the front desk staff acted like they didn't like their jobs nor wanted to be there. The only other issue we had was the mediocre breakfast. The only coffee available was instant Nescafe. We ate breakfast once there but opted to nearby pastry shops for other breakfasts. To future visitors of Istanbul...look else where....there are plenty of other hotels in that immediate area.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely the best choice!”
Reviews.Author: EliseSaoPaulo
Reviews.Content: Couldn't be happier with Side Hotel in Sultanahmet. Great location just by the main tourist sites, super clean and very friendly staff. I have looked at a few hotels in the area just for comparison and Side Hotel was by far the best quality-price-service hotel in the area. It was a very nice surprise to certify personally all the positive reviews I had read about the hotel before my trip. Not to mention I stayed in the pension and canâ€™t imagine how great the hotel must be. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - short walk to Blue Mosque and public transportation”
Reviews.Author: ontheroad2009
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights here in January, and really enjoyed it. The showers had hot water, the free wi-fi worked in our room, the breakfast on the roof was good, the view of the Bosphorous and Blue Mosque from the roof was great, and the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia are less than a five minute walk from the hotel. Lots of restaurants and shops in close proximately as well. We took to metro from the airport, and made one switch at Zeytinbumu to a tram to the Sultanahmet (Blue Mosque) stop. From there it was about a ten minute walk to the hotel Took about an hour. We showed a local taxi driver the address to the hotel and they pointed us in the right direction. We stayed in the pension, and it seemed competitively priced with other options in the neighborhood. No tv in the room in the pension, but they had a small tv in the lobby area.

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul not Constantinople”
Reviews.Author: Davejojo
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing stay at the Side. Very simple, very clean, and very friendly staff. This facility is perfect for those who plan to spend very little time in the hotel room, as the rooms are small. You can't ask for a better location as the side literally steps away for the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofya. The view, and authentic Turkish breakfast is the perfect way to start the day. The only issue we had is that the shower tends to leak on the bathroom floor, making it kind of hard to stand around the mirror afterwards and get ready.

Reviews.Title: “Side is the Best!”
Reviews.Author: WithoutBordersLondon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to stay at Side for a few days in November. It was clean, spacious and well-organized. The managers/owners there were very personable and accommodating. The waitstaff was also very friendly. It's one of the cheaper options and in a really good location (less than 5 minute walk to Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia and within walking distance of the Grand Bazaar, waterfront and Spice Market). We both highly recommend it! Seasoned Travelers, London :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, Breakfast and Owner”
Reviews.Author: LolTol
Reviews.Content: We arrived late one evening having been messed around by the guesthouse we had booked for our last night in Istanbul. Our pension room at Side was great! Very clean and well decorated ( If the pension rooms looked like that, the hotel rooms must be fab!). In the morning, we had a lovely breakfast on the terrace overlooking Istanbul. The co-owner came over to welcome us, which was a lovely touch.

Reviews.Title: “clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: chrissysunshine
Reviews.Content: There is nothing wrong with this hotel, it's clean and comfortable, has hot water and some charming old mouldings and windows ect. Breakfast was good, but I wanted more, there is sort of a view of the Blue Mosque and Bosphorus. The location is fantastic, right in the thick of things in Sultanamet. But I felt that it was a bit overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “clean, comfortable, but unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: backpackingwithstyle
Reviews.Content: the title sums it up: we stayed in the pension in a double room with our own bathroom. In retrospect, I wish we shared a bathroom to reduce the price or stayed somewhere else. It wasn't really worth it. While it was incredibly clean, and comfortable (with a beautiful roof top terrance) the staff were unfriendly, unhelpful and sometimes very rude. I don't think they wanted to be there. I had emailed in advance and asked if the hotel could help us arrange bus transport to our other destinations. They said, sure it would be no problem. But when we arrived, their form of help involved directing us to their friends travel agency who gave us very partial information, and tried to mislead us with information so that we would go with his company. When I went back to the hotel/pension, to ask about other ways to get to our destination (with other bus companies), they refused to help. As a result, we had to figure things out ourselves which cost us time, money, and unexpected detours. I should note, that the older couple serving breakfast were lovely. I think they were the parents who started the hotel - and their sons, nephews, etc. who took over the daily tasks were less than impressed with their familial role in the hotel. TIP: Ask for a room with a window.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cowellen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel and it was lovely - just like all the other reviews said, cheap and very cheerful.. .

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - nice price - nice location close to The Blue Mosque.”
Reviews.Author: AKielerKofod
Reviews.Content: We were in Istanbul two times this year. After our first stay we was sure we want to go back to Side Hotel again. The location is superb ( the Blue Mosque, the Aya Sofya a Topkapi Palace & the bassar). The rooms are medium sized, clean and quiet. Breakfast is traditional turkish and good , and is served on the terrace which has fantastic views ower the starit of Bosporus Why staying on one of the big international hotels a few minutes away to a price x 10..

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: OzMonti
Reviews.Content: Good Location to all the sites, Great views from the terrace, the place is very clean, Breakfast is nice, especially relaxing on the roof terrace! One member of staff who deserves a special mention is the breakfast waitress, a lovely lady, very pleasant. One thing to watch out for is the travel agent next door if you are approached in the reception area at the hotel, Beware! I would definitely not recommend booking with them.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location - great value for money”
Reviews.Author: JennyESouthAfrica
Reviews.Content: We could not have found a better location in Istanbul than the Side Hotel & pension. We were 5 minutes away from all the major tourist attractions and 10 minutes on foot from the Grand Bazaar. The nearby tram at Sutlanahmet made local travel easy and cheap. The view from the terrace where they served a lovely breakfast, was stunning with clear views of the Bospherous sea as well the Blue Mosque and Aya Sophya. The staff were polite, helpful & honest & we were able to leave luggage at the hotel after checking out to go sight seeing. They also organised transport to the out lying airport Sabia Gocken. The rooms were air conditioned, clean and quite adequate in every way. All in all, we were very happy

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate, safe, friendly, location superb, beautiful presentation!”
Reviews.Author: Kiwigoingabroad
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here several days including the weekend just gone, which was May Day weekend in Europe. The room was absolutely spotless, the website or brochure does not do itself credit, the rooms superior by far. There is always trepidation booking online, as you want to make sure you will have good surroundings if in and out of the hotel. This one we walked into the room, and just saidf to each other- It's perfect! We were in the Pension, with a private bathroom. The bathroom alone was superb, huge, great shower, linen spotless, and space!! As was the bedroom. The tartan rug finish on the bed is quaint, but fitting with the small Turkish flloor rug, and the rooms warm, spacious, but above all, so clean, refreshing simple but lovely decor. I have recommended to a friend going in a month, and will go back. Breakfasts were excellent, great olives! The view unrivalled, one cold take sunrise photos from this rooftop at Side Hotel of the Blue Mosque. Good restaurants are all around, close to everything you want and need, plus a mini mart on the corner of street opposite if you want a quick snack or fruit/ confectionery. Safe boxes are available, free tea/ hot water/ internet is cheap. Good lobby storage room for bags. We incorrectly booked and had to find an extra nights accomodation at the end when they were full; they did it all for us, in the same price range, about 50metres away on the next street. Lovely relaxing accomodation, highly recommend. Given it's location it is very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “They treated me like family”
Reviews.Author: RayGunner
Reviews.Content: I definitely enjoyed my stay at Side Hotel and plan to stay there again on a future trip to Istanbul. People's reviews here describe the staff negatively and my experience was so different than theirs, it makes me wonder how picky some people can be. The staff was quite sympathetic in an uneventful situation I had in Turkey and always were willing to help. That said, from a price-to-value perspective, Side Hotel (smack in the middle of the Sultanahmet area) offers very clean rooms, although a little noisy at night, free wireless internet, and yes, a helpful and nice staff. The room pictures you see on the internet do not do justice to the apartments as they are nicer in real life.

Reviews.Title: “exellent location very bad at reception”
Reviews.Author: troyano-ger
Reviews.Content: We have been there my girlfriend and myself to spend a week for tourism.Rooms at reasonable price ,exellent location .Extreemly bad receptionists.We had to wait 7 minutes to get our room key because Oce ,the receptionist ,had to finish smoking his cigarette.No information whatsover beside trying to sell their own tourism package.No smile at all.The rooms at te rear are very loud and noisy at night ( dogs barking,extractor,heat device etc) Even at the top floor views are very limited.Breakfast very basic ( bread,1 boiled egg ,tomatoe + coffe.Personel at breakfast ,Mr.BÃ¼land ,the boss himself was very efficient and kind.

Reviews.Title: “Nice if you don't mind the staff smoking in the lobby”
Reviews.Author: snooperdooper
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel for the money and in a great location... Amazing view from the restaurant on the roof and the room were ok... However, the staff smoked in the downstairs lobby...

Reviews.Title: “Location great, price great!”
Reviews.Author: joeswelch
Reviews.Content: The Side pension was exactly what we wanted. Affordable accommodation in a central location. Some reviews suggest an unhelpful reception staff but I think this is a 'lost in translation' moment rather than a rudeness of staff. That is what I feel anyway. The location is amazing and if you like walking you can go anywhere in Istanbul from the Mosaic museum to the glitzy part of town with the shopping etc. Breakfast was good (although the same everyday) and we only paid 50 euro a night. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel for guests on a budget like me!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good quality, good price”
Reviews.Author: One-Human-World
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just at two blocks of the Aya Sophia and the Blue Mosque in a quiet street. Very safe part of town. I stayed in the Pension which has a good qualities of bed, very clean and nicely decorated. The bathrooms are very clean, good sizes, included the rooms with share bathrooms (2 bathrooms for 4 rooms). The hotel is very modern with a friendly staff. The room price includes Turkish breakfast which is very good (egg, fresh bread, olives, tomates, jam, cumcumber, tea/coffee). The breakfast is served in their roof terrace where you a have a great view of the Aya Sophia and Blue Mosque. The price of the room is very good for the quality and the location of the hotel. The hotel has good internet services and left luggage area. The tram stop is only a few blocks from the hotel which is handy to get to/from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “great! but not a non-smoking locale”
Reviews.Author: becooldude
Reviews.Content: my wife and i stayed one night. typical abrasive front desk staff. beautiful roof-top terrace with really nice breakfast - the best olives - great view of sea of marmara, hagia sofia, blue mosque. we stayed in a double room on the hotel side. nice clean room. this hotel actually had a cleaning staff! clean bathroom with good size shower. staff lowered our bill when the exchange rate went down. while there are no smoking signs throughout the hotel, and even posters depicting a dead-end life for smokers in the lobby, hotel staff smokes in the building, which permeates throughout. constant smell of smoke. prolific smoking on the rooftop terrace by all.

Reviews.Title: “Side Hotel and Pension”
Reviews.Author: Adele73
Reviews.Content: Side Hotel and Pension has a great location, solid facilities, very, very clean shared bathrooms and rooms, and super terrace and enjoyable and very timely served breakfast. We liked the Side for all these above reasons. Also they have an excellent safety box system that allows for every room to have it's own box. They also have a room to hold luggage when you are either coming early/leaving later than checkout time. We stayed in one of the front rooms with shared bathroom. There were two full bathrooms on each floor and were always clean. The cleaning staff was excellent. Having read previous reviews of Side Hotel and Pension, and then having stayed there, I can address the stated lower level of check in. Our check-in person was initially somewhat negative, but after we assured them that we just wanted to check out the room and that we would subsequently pay in cash (as requested in the reservation correspondence), everything was OK and he was quite friendly throughout our stay. We would definately return to Side Hotel and Pension - location, security, cleanliness, wonderful breakfast and super terrace.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Pepetualtraveller
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment. We stayed at the Side in 2005 and again this year and have to say that it has gone downhill very fast. The day time front desk service was atrocious , though the night staff were helpful. The breakfasts were very poor quality and the hotel itself looked as though little had been spent on refurbishment and day to day repairs. It looked shabby. We have travelled extensively in Turkey and can say that there are better accommodations available. The Side is not to be recommended until it cleans up its act - a pity given its location. It is trading on its past reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Find somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: victeach
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Side on recommendation from family that stayed here a few years ago. They raved about the beautiful facilities, terraced patio, and friendly staff (family run). I was highly disappointed and will be telling those who suggest the Side hotel as a great little place to stay to stop doing so. There is very little difference between the hotel and pension rooms, they are hot, noisy, very basic, and super overpriced for what you get. The cleaning staff are great and do a good job with keeping rooms tidy and supplied fresh towels and sheets but the reception staff downstairs is downright surly and rude. They claim to not accept payment by credit card because "their machine is broken" but then are miraculously able to charge you for nights if you don't stay as long as you booked for. Turkish breakfast is the same all over the country and hard to mess up (tomatoes, olives, cheese, bread) but Side manages to with moldy bread one day and processed cheese. All in all, a negative experience and there are many better choices in the Sultanahmet area that would give you better value for money and better service. A big NO to the Side.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service at Clean, Well-Located Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rosannasf2000
Reviews.Content: I write this review from the perspective of someone whose family has run a resort hotel for over 40 years. My husband and I just visited Turkey where we enjoyed the famed Turkish hospitality throughout our travels with one exception: the Side Hotel and Pension in Istanbul, which was unfortunately recommended by a friend who lives in Istanbul On the plus side, the hotel is clean, reasonably priced and has an extremely convenient location. Breakfast is served on a lovely terrace with a city view. We would never stay there again, however, because the hotel operators provide poor service. First, it was extremely difficult to make a reservation. In a city where there are many good English speakers in the tourism industy, the hotel clerks do not speak competent English (despite the fact that the hotel clientele is virtually all English speakers). They refused to take a reservation over the phone or over the internet. They wanted us to fax the reservation, but their fax machine was either broken or shut off for many hours each . I was finally able to make a reservation upon my fifth attempt to fax their reservation form to them. This process took three days. Secondly, the hotel refuses to accept credit cards for payment. Although they informed us of this policy when we checked in, we were so jet-lagged that we forgot. We almost missed our flight because my husband had to run out and find an ATM machine, which was not close by, to obtain cash. Thirdly, the day clerk, who was one of the laziest human beings I have encoutered, refused to help us with directions, information about laundry faciltiies or transportation. He referred us to the night clerks, who I had to ask FIVE TIMES to order a cab for us to the airport. They demanded immediate payment before they would do so. Fourth, the clerks never remembered to give us a wake-up call even after we explained we had lost our travel alarm clock. We understood the reason on the day when we checked out when we had to shake the clerk from a deep sleep so he could unlock the front door so we could leave for the airport. In short, even though we were paying hotel rates, the Side Hotel provided us with pension service. I heartily recommend that you consider staying at one of the other nearby hotels. Rosanna Russell San Francisco July 7, 2008

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with the Side”
Reviews.Author: aec977
Reviews.Content: we were told that this place was great, and I'm sure it used to be. The breakfast was poor, the room was never below 28 degrees, and the front desk staff was often rude. They refused to take credit cards, which wasn't confirmed upon making our reservations. Wouldn't stay here again. Too bad, as the chamber maids were very sweet and friendly, and the hostel itself is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Mortib01
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i stayed here at the beginning of May. We had a room at the front of the hotel with a shared bathroom. It is excellent value for it's proximity to the tourist attractions in Sultanahmet. Sharing a bathroom was not a problem at all everything was beutifully clean and the staff were helpful. Breakfast on the terrace was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great room but rude/aggressive reception”
Reviews.Author: angonga
Reviews.Content: The pension room was great- clean, bright and tastefully decorated. Value for money at the Side if you can overlook, or even better avoid the rude staff. I witnessed them abusing and threatening clients who were very meek and mild. Just bullies really. Never book nights and then decide that you want to leave early. This seemed to be the subject of some battles. They deduct from your credit card and there is not a thing you can do about it.

Reviews.Title: “great location & very clean.. reception rude.”
Reviews.Author: Chooklotto
Reviews.Content: Booked here before and after a trip - room was basic but spotless. Brekky on the upstairs terrace was traditionally turkish - cucumber, tomatoes, olives & 1/2 bread loaf & tea was really yum - staff up here are nice & friendly. As for reception, depending on who you get & what time of day it is rude and not very unhelpful. Close to sights - blue mosque & aya sofia around the corner so expect a morning wake up prayer call at 5am.

Reviews.Title: “Not the most friendly service”
Reviews.Author: coeccc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Side Pension for 4 nights. The location is great, rooms are okay for the price and the breakfast was nice. The reception was terrible and not that friendly. I would ask for information and help and the 3 different men who worked reception were grouchy and annoyed when you asked them a question. And don't get them to pick you up at the airport, they over charge you even though they say that the taxi overcharges, The cost of a taxi is so much cheaper! I would only stay at this place because of location and price but if you have a bit more money to spend, I recommend staying somewhere else with a more friendly reception.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Hospitable Staff!”
Reviews.Author: ptran802
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! Centrally located in the historic neighborhood with the major sights just steps from the hotel. the rooms were very charming, well maintained and clean! The staff is very accommodating and even after my stay, after I had forgotten a personal item in the room, they were very kind to arrange with me its return! Side Hotel made Istanbul a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Clean but very rude staff”
Reviews.Author: shortsNtshirt
Reviews.Content: Looking for clean rooms then great. If you would like a little comfort or help from hotel staff forget it. Any help you ask for is treated as if youâ€™re asking a man who's run a marathon to quickly pop down to the shops for some milk before he talks his trainers off. So the location works well, but then again there are a number of hotels in that area which have roof tops breakfast room which have an actual view of one of the mosques or water front. Would be great to hear a report about this place having good reviews, with so much competition they will need it to get my recommendation in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous budget option in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Cintagreen
Reviews.Content: Side Pension/Hotel is split up (there's even two separate lobbies) into the hotel, and cheaper pension. I stayed in a triple room with bathroom and nice view (60 euro), then switched to a cheaper (45 Euro) and smaller room with shared bathroom, and no view. The rooms are basic, but clean. The smaller room was a great deal for us since we didn't spend much time in the hotel anyway, and the shared bathrooms were spotless and seemed brand new. The location is nothng short of amazing- in central Sultanahmet, just doors away from the Four Seasons and behind the Blue Mosque. The two story rooftop has incredible views of the mosques, the city, and the Bosphorus. The owner and employees are incredibly helpful and friendly. There are three or four computers with high speed internet access, and while they charge for usage, the employees aren't super strict with timing. There is free tea, coffee, and water, and plenty of guidebooks for you to browse through. Breakfast served on the roof. It was basic but filling and good, and you really can't beat the view. The cost for three of us really wasn't that much different from the hostel down the street, but this was such a nicer experience. I'd definitely come back here in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: NatashaMoscow
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel/pension many times and recommend it to my friends and colleagues. The rooms are clean and nice, the facility is exactly as advertised in their website. You can't beat the prices, and the location is perfect, just minutes from Aghia Sophia and the Blue Mosque and many nice restaurants and shopping. Breakfast is efficiently served, delicious, and generous portions. The personnel are courteous and helpful. For example, in getting taxis and performance tickets, the evening man, Mettin, was very helpful and kind. His colleague, Levvent, was also very kind during the day to answer questions and offer information. My friends and I can't imagine staying anywhere else. You can pay twice the price, but you won't get a better place. The view from the terrace where breakfast is served is spectacular. That alone is worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, cheap and attractive”
Reviews.Author: spincat
Reviews.Content: The Side is in Sultanahamet district, a few minutes from Aya Sophia, the Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace. This is *the* area for hotels and hostels, so a lot of the restaurants and nightlife establishments are geared to tourists. The Side's location means that you can get to many of the big tourist attractions in Istanbul very easily, but you might not see other sides to the city if you stay in the area all the time. Excellent value, particularly out of season. Rooms start at 23 euros per night, without a shower. Our 'with shower' room wasn't much more, Note for those on a very tight budget: if I stayed again, I would be quite happy to share a bathroom as they were so clean, and never seemed to be in use! The building is divided into hotel and pension. The hotel rooms are rather more expensive, but I didn't actually see how the rooms compared. The pictures on the excellent Side website gave an accurate idea of how our room looked, so it is worth checking those. One word of warning: not all the pension rooms are quite so good. I specifically requested a room on a high floor with plenty of light, because of I had heard not all the rooms had windows. I got just what I wanted, though the rooms all seem very small, but i did see another (even smaller ) pension room in passing: a three-bed room with a tiny window. The pension rooms are very simply and tastefully decorated, with a comfortable decorative-iron bed.
