It was quite small, however, with limited wardrobe space and very few drawers, but that didn't diminish its overall charm. This is a clean comfortable place and exceptional value so my quiblles are very small. The bathroom was roomy and really clean - loads of hot water. The view was over old Turkish houses in a quiet street to the posh Four Seasons hotel at the end. Downstairs there is a narrow communal area with two computers for checking emails (small extra cost) free tea, and a little library. The desk staff are mostly friendly and helpful. The breakfast room is on the pretty roof terrace - views over the minarets. The Turkish breakfast was included in the price and excellent - very healthy - with tomatoes, cucumber, olives, very fresh bread, little cheese triangle, boiled egg and jam. This could come as a shock to an 'eggs and bacon' person, I suppose! I got to like this kind of breakfast so much we sometimes make it back home. Very friendly service. During the summer, people bring tea or beer up to the pretty roof terrace and sit out. We were here in the winter and watched snow fall to the sound of the muezzin on Christmas day.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: midlife_trip
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 4 nights in one of the basement apartments. it was clean and had windows that opened so we were pretty happy. its supposed self catering facilities were one electric hotplate with two elements and a limited amount of equipment but was adequate for the basic food we prepared.the parts of it that we saw were beautifully presented. the older guys who run it were really helpful, the younger ones much less so but could be bothered when pressed for information. breakfast was fresh and filling and always served with a smile in the enclosed area on the roof. the only drawback was their recommendation of a travel agent next door - beware.

Reviews.Title: “Ordinary hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ducktalk
Reviews.Content: We booked an apartment. Sounds good doesn't it, but in reality we'd have slit our wrists had we stayed there longer (3 nights before we escaped the horror of Turkey). Man the room was depressing. GOOD STUFF * apartment was spacious & relatively clean * had a separate lounge area to watch TV * had good overhead lighting (to make up for the dungeon feel and dark dark room no doubt) * breakfast was on a pleasant terrace * it had a FRIDGE (magnificent asset when the weather is hot) * good location in Sultanahmet * reasonably priced for Istanbul NOT SO GOOD STUFF * below ground location so incredibly dark & unappealing * thin towels, no bathmat, no hand towels * the whole bathroom got wet when you showered - the Turks have this bizarre habit of putting the toilet right next to the shower with nothing to separate them- hence EVERYTHING gets a thorough dousing, so only two towels is a huge annoyance * darned noisy (due to being below ground and the yowling of the muezzin) * kitchen didn't have a tea towel, kettle or glasses & only one sad little mug * hotel doesn't take credit cards for payment - only cash which was a nuisance as we were about to leave the country and had precious little cash left * usual unfriendly disinterested (male as always) staff * breakfast was dead ordinary - and gee it'd be nice if the folk serving would smile and be pleasant * really dubious safety on the electricity points/plugs in the apartment * fan in room didn't work; and the loo leaked (a common problem shared with many across Turkey) * last but not least, the transfer we booked from the airport took three times longer than normal due to a lot of stuffing around on the driver's behalf (it's a long story) - we were seriously cheesed off about this. It's as if they think our time is not precious and we can be stuffed around because they want to scam someone else. I cannot begin to tell you how angry I was about this and it did have an impact on my impression of the hotel because they booked it for us.

Reviews.Title: “Trust me on this one, this hotel is way overrated!!”
Reviews.Author: Matt89
Reviews.Content: I think it is important to point out, that this is a budget hotel. Even a guest staying in the Hotel portion as opposed to the Pension option, should be aware of this fact. The location is superb, as many people have noted. If your time in Istanbul is short, this is a good area. Upon checking into the hotel, a gentleman behind the counter said, "are you late." On behalf, of British Airways, we apologize, I wanted to say. Not exactly Turkish Hospitality at its best. We were given one of the "nicest rooms" according to front desk agent. It was on the third floor, so a bit of a hike with luggage and no elevator. The room was painted in a nice blue color but other that that it had the feel of a college dorm room. The beds were as hard as the floor with a skimpy pillow and sheets and thick as paper. The room was air conditioned, which was nice. The bathroom was small and the shower was adequate. The complimentary breakfast on the terrace was below expectations. Olives, bread, juices and coffee and tea. Also tomatoes. It was served on a lovely terrace with amazing views of the Sultanhamet area. I actually found myself, dreading this hotel, upon returning from touring Istanbul. Perhaps it was that so many guide books recommend this hotel. We met about 6 employees of the Side hotel. With the exception of a very friendly housekeeper, none of them were particularly friendly. When considering this hotel, be aware this is a budget hotel with a good rate in a great area. You will be disppointed if you expect any more than this.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: tania73
Reviews.Content: We were in Istanbul a few weeks ago and chose the Side Hotel for our stay there, after some friends had recommended it to us. The location is brilliant (behind the Blue Mosque, and close to the Aya Sofya a Topkapi Palace) and the service quite good. The rooms are medium sized, clean and quiet. We asked for a room with AC but actually didn't use it much since the weather was cooler than we expected. Breakfast is traditional turkish and good (loved those olives), and is served on the terrace which has fantastic views. For our photos of the hotel please see here: http://www.flickr.com/photos/taniaho/tags/sidehotel/

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Spookyrain
Reviews.Content: I wish I could take this pension to every place I go! It is clean, friendly, includes breakfast and has great views!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: The_Tembas
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the budget rooms in this hotel and found them nice and well cared for. They had central heating which was a must in the cold winter while we were there (January). The rooms were definitely budget but clean and and a good value for the price. Bathrooms were very clean. The place had self serve apple tea (apple cider) and tea which was nice. Internet was reasonable for a hotel. The breakfast was very good and served by friendly staff. The location was fantastic, right by the major sites. The front desk was interesting in that one receptionist was super helpful and friendly and seemed to love his job and the other receptionist (usually at night) was rude and surly and a total blowhard. We guessed that he was probably a relative of the owner and couldn't be fired. You couldn't ask for a worse person to meet your guests at the the desk.

HotelInfo.Name: Side Hotel and Pension
HotelInfo.Address: 20 Utangac Street, Istanbul 34400, Turkey
